links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
Index entries for sequences of the a(a(n)) = 2n family
formula: if n is a square then a(n)=a(sqrt(n))^2, otherwise if the difference between n and the highest square less than n is odd then a(n)=n+1, otherwise a(n)=(n-1)^2
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Which[r = Sqrt[n]; IntegerQ[r], a[r]^2, OddQ[n - Floor[r]^2], n+1, True, (n-1)^2]; a[0]=0; a[1]=1; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 58}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Aug 07 2012, after formula *)
prog: (Haskell)a054791 n = a054791_list `genericIndex` na054791_list = 0 : 1 : f 2 where   f x | r ^ 2 == x  = a054791 r ^ 2 : f (x + 1)       | odd (x - r) = x + 1         : f (x + 1)       | otherwise   = (x - 1) ^ 2   : f (x + 1)       where r = a000196 x-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 27 2013
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 27 2000
